{{ModID}}_WinterPansySeeds.Name: Lilac Pansy Seeds
{{ModID}}_WinterPansySeeds.Description: Plant them in winter. Take 6 days to produce a beautiful flower.

{{ModID}}_ClematisStarter.Name: Pink Clematis Starter
{{ModID}}_ClematisStarter.Description: Plant them in fall. Take 13 days to produce a flower and continue to produce after that.

{{ModID}}_HollyhockSeeds.Name: Pink Hollyhock Seeds
{{ModID}}_HollyhockSeeds.Description: Plant them in spring, summer or fall. Take 18 days to produce a flower, and continue to produce after that

{{ModID}}_PurpleFlameSeeds.Name: Purple Flame Seeds
{{ModID}}_PurpleFlameSeeds.Description: Plant them in fall. Take 8 days to produce a beautiful flower.

{{ModID}}_IrisSeeds.Name: Purple Iris Seeds
{{ModID}}_IrisSeeds.Description: Plant them in spring. Take 7 days to produce a beautiful flower.

{{ModID}}_SpringPansySeeds.Name: Purple Pansy Seeds
{{ModID}}_SpringPansySeeds.Description: Plant them in spring. Take 6 days to produce a beautiful flower.

{{ModID}}_RomanescoCabbageSeeds.Name: Romanesco Cabbage Seeds
{{ModID}}_RomanescoCabbageSeeds.Description: Plant them in fall or winter. Take 14 days to produce.

{{ModID}}_FoxgloveSeeds.Name: Sugar Plum Foxglove Seeds
{{ModID}}_FoxgloveSeeds.Description: Plant them in summer. Take 11 days to produce a flower.

{{ModID}}_TallMallowSeeds.Name: Tall Mallow Seeds
{{ModID}}_TallMallowSeeds.Description: Plant them in summer. Take 10 days to produce a flower and continue to produce after that.

{{ModID}}_WinterIrisBulb.Name: Winter Blue Iris Bulb
{{ModID}}_WinterIrisBulb.Description: Plant them in winter. Take 14 days to produce a tiny beautiful flower.

{{ModID}}_DahliaSeeds.Name: Dahlia Seeds
{{ModID}}_DahliaSeeds.Description: Plant them in spring, grow during spring and summer. Take 15 days to produce a flower, and continue to produce after that.

{{ModID}}_VoidLilySeeds.Name: Void Lily Seeds
{{ModID}}_VoidLilySeeds.Description: Plant them in summer, grow during summer and fall. Take 20 days to produce a flower.

{{ModID}}_WillowherbSeeds.Name: Willowherb Seeds
{{ModID}}_WillowherbSeeds.Description: Plant them in fall. Take 12 days to produce flowers, then regrow after that.

{{ModID}}_SpottedOrchisSeeds.Name: Spotted Orchis Seeds
{{ModID}}_SpottedOrchisSeeds.Description: Plant them in spring. Take 13 days to produce a flower.

{{ModID}}_GiantFernSeeds.Name: Giant Fern Seeds
{{ModID}}_GiantFernSeeds.Description: Plant them in summer. Take 12 days to produce a decorative plume, and continue to produce after that.

{{ModID}}_LilacSapling.Name: Lilac Sapling
{{ModID}}_LilacSapling.Description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Lilac tree. Blossom in the spring and summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

{{ModID}}_Cornflower.Name: Azure Cornflower
{{ModID}}_Cornflower.Description: A flower that often grow in field of wheat.

{{ModID}}_Borage.Name: Blue Borage
{{ModID}}_Borage.Description: A star-shaped blue flower and edible leaves.

{{ModID}}_BlueFlame.Name: Blue Flame
{{ModID}}_BlueFlame.Description: A vivid blue flower with the shape of a flame

{{ModID}}_ForgetMeNot.Name: Blue Forget Me Not
{{ModID}}_ForgetMeNot.Description: A flower with a sweet meaning.

{{ModID}}_ButterflyLavender.Name: Butterfly Lavender
{{ModID}}_ButterflyLavender.Description: A flower less fragrant than the usual lavender cultivar, but with pretty petals like a butterfly.

{{ModID}}_Snowdrop.Name: Giant Snowdrop
{{ModID}}_Snowdrop.Description: A flower able to grow even when there is snow.

{{ModID}}_SpringBells.Name: Giant Spring Bells
{{ModID}}_SpringBells.Description: A bell-shaped white flower, symbol of spring.

{{ModID}}_Calendula.Name: Golden Calendula
{{ModID}}_Calendula.Description: A golden flower like a tiny sun.

{{ModID}}_WinterPansy.Name: Lilac Pansy
{{ModID}}_WinterPansy.Description: A delicate flower with a subtle fragrance, able to grow despite the cold.

{{ModID}}_Clematis.Name: Pink Clematis
{{ModID}}_Clematis.Description: The flower of a sturdy climbing plant.

{{ModID}}_Hollyhock.Name: Pink Hollyhock
{{ModID}}_Hollyhock.Description: A flower of a delicate pink.

{{ModID}}_PurpleFlame.Name: Purple Flame
{{ModID}}_PurpleFlame.Description: A vivid purple flower with the shape of a flame

{{ModID}}_Iris.Name: Purple Iris
{{ModID}}_Iris.Description: A decorative flower also used in perfumes.

{{ModID}}_SpringPansy.Name: Purple Pansy
{{ModID}}_SpringPansy.Description: A delicate flower with a subtle fragrance.

{{ModID}}_RomanescoCabbage.Name: Romanesco Cabbage
{{ModID}}_RomanescoCabbage.Description: A variety of cabbage, growing following a fractal pattern.

{{ModID}}_Foxglove.Name: Sugar Plum Foxglove
{{ModID}}_Foxglove.Description: A beautiful but toxic flower. Be careful with childrens and pets.

{{ModID}}_TallMallow.Name: Tall Mallow
{{ModID}}_TallMallow.Description: A flower with petals sometimes used in herbal teas.

{{ModID}}_WinterIris.Name: Winter Blue Iris
{{ModID}}_WinterIris.Description: A slightly perfumed flower, blossoming in winter.

{{ModID}}_Dahlia.Name: Dahlia
{{ModID}}_Dahlia.Description: It has delicate touches of color.

{{ModID}}_VoidLily.Name: Void Lily
{{ModID}}_VoidLily.Description: Rumors make them the favorite flowers of witches, because of their colors. But no one ever came with proofs...

{{ModID}}_WillowherbFlower.Name: Willowherb Flower
{{ModID}}_WillowherbFlower.Description: A wildflower. Would it be less pretty, it would be considered a weed.

{{ModID}}_SpottedOrchis.Name: Spotted Orchis
{{ModID}}_SpottedOrchis.Description: An orchid with spots on flowers and leaves.

{{ModID}}_GiantFernPlume.Name: Giant Fern Plume
{{ModID}}_GiantFernPlume.Description: It's used for decoration by florists.
